intro: Hieracium chlorospermum, commonly known as the green-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, which aid in its propagation. Hieracium chlorospermum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
